Experience Lead Frontend Engineer Google October 2014  – Present (10 months) Hyderabad Area, India My current role as the tech lead and frontend developer involves:- 
Conceptualizing platform/solution specifics for automation pertaining to sales internal automation requirements. 
Define end user experience. 
Estimation time lines and identifying bottlenecks. 
Managing stakeholders. 
Identifying newer technologies and induce their advantages into current systems. 
Plan maintenance, bug handling and upgrades. Business Analyst/Tech Lead Google January 2014  –  October 2014  (10 months) Hyderabad Technical Operations Specialist Google April 2012  –  January 2014  (1 year 10 months) Hyderabad Area, India The Approval Bin team at Google is responsible for verifying the adherence of text ads to Google’s advertising guidelines and policies. The guidelines and policies are in place to ensure good user experience to people viewing ads and to follow the applicable laws in countries where they appear. The team started by manually reviewing each ad and passing approval decision on each one of them. The Technical Operations team is in place to identify automation of the workflow of the approval bin team, conceptualize the solution, execute the plan and test/maintain it with possible upgrades. As a Technical Operations Specialist, my responsibilities include 
•	Identifying scope of automation and efficiency improvement for the Approval Bin team. 
•	Assessing incoming project requests. 
•	Prioritizing projects. 
•	Modular planning of projects and identifying individual tasks in them. 
•	Estimating complexity of tasks and setting deadlines for each task. 
•	Assigning tasks to the tools team members and tracking progress. 
•	Upgrading my knowledge with newer Google/industry technologies and identify implementation of better methods to improve the development/deployment procedure. 
•	Conducting training to upgrade the technical expertise of the fellow team members. 
•	Plan testing of tools by working with the individual workflow leads and gather feedback for upgrades. Developer Relations Specialist Google June 2011  –  April 2012  (11 months) Hyderabad Area, India, Google Checkout is the online payment-processing platform for online purchases. It offers several means of implementation and integration for publishers with their websites like the “Buy Now” button, Store Gadget, Checkout cart, and an XML API. 
 
As a Developer Relations Engineer, my daily job involves engaging with developers around the world and to help them be successful as they build their applications and online stores. The engagement involved exchange of email(s), discussion forums, mailing lists and video based tutorials. The role also involved writing sample code for developers, contributing to open source client libraries and creating tutorials to assist the developers. 
 
Another aspect of the role was to work with the Ops team in Hyderabad. The ops team acts as the first level support for checkout related queries. Approximately 25% of the queries are related to integration. The ops team is not trained to handle technically inclined questions, so my job involved educating them on how certain integration options work, helping them provide the developer with the relevant information and in case of a complex situation, take up the case as an escalation and directly interact with the developer/business owner to help them integrate better with our system and products. I was also instrumental in hiring a team of vendors who would act as the first level of support, and train them. (Open) 1 project Posteet The idea of this project came from a colleague. The challenge with the checkout buy now button is that it needs a <form> element to submit data to Checkout for populating a shopping cart. In case of platforms like Blogger/Wordpress, Twitter,... Analyst, Consumer Operations Google November 2005  –  January 2011  (5 years 3 months) To identify bottle necks for Consumer Operations in terms of automation and suggest solutions. 
Develop automated solutions using technologies like PHP, Javascript, Python and MySql. 
Collaborate with the Global Consumer Operations team to device newer methodologies to work with in terms of action plans.

Sr. Technical Support Engineer Webhelp May 2003  –  November 2005  (2 years 7 months) I started off working as a Technical Support Engineer providing voice based technical support(laptops) for the US customers. I then moved to providing technical support for Desktops and printers for the US customers. Based on my excellent track record, I was posted as an escalation technician for the team. 
 
The responsibilities of an escalation technician are to identify the issues which were not solvable by other technicians and provide personalized support through callbacks at convenient time. I was awarded the award for Best Escalation technician for achieving the highest amount of customer satisfaction in Hyderabad. Sr. Technical Support Engineer Dell November 2003  –  April 2005  (1 year 6 months) As a Senior Technical Support Engineer, my core responsibilities involved troubleshooting issues with Dell Laptops for customer from the US and Canada. I was also the outbound tech for my time and the responsibilities involved proactively calling customer back to check for any unresolved issues, taking up escalations and getting them resolved. Summary I'm an operations and support specialist with over two decades of experience in managing products, leading teams, and overseeing the client experience. I’m technically minded, and have worn several hats in my past roles; including product manager, webmaster, and graphic designer. I have an old-fashioned work ethic, an eye towards improving existing systems, and empathy with the customer’s needs. 
 
What have I done? 
 
Created documentation for training, client education, and product implementation. 
Worried out new product features from existing internal tools and products. 
Resolved hundreds of customer issues via email support. 
Acted as a go-between for operations, product teams, and engineering. 
Supported products as diverse as online maps, media storefronts, and education programs. 
 
What can I do? 
 
CREATE: organizational systems for tracking and documentation. 
MANAGE: people, teams, tasks, and products. 
DOCUMENT: policies, processes, and training materials. 
RECRUIT: interview candidates and evaluate team members. 
EDUCATE: train and onboard team members. 
 
Now seeking growth opportunities in nurturing environments, with passionate people and rewarding products. -Marilyn Manson 
 
There is my shock factor for my summary, did it make you want to read more?  
 
It is funny but I truly feel this quote sums up the business world. There are constantly new needs in business and goals are always changing; If a business was able to accomplish every goal and grant every wish then what else would we strive for? Business in the tech industry is constantly changing and my job is to adapt and help companies with those changes. I am an analytical people person which can help companies develop their new products and view things from a customer's standpoint, while maintaining the operations and developing workflows to establish solid products and support. Summary I've worked at Google for 7 years and have had the privilege of working in Finance and Sales before making the jump to Product where I am currently the Program Manager for Google Apps for Education at Google in New York. In addition to my core responsibilities, I have a passion to volunteer and consider myself a "social intrapraneur." I started Google Reach - a corporate volunteer program for Google, I am founder and director of the Community Leaders Program - a digital literacy program offered in six cities across the US, and I am the committee lead for employee volunteering for the NYC office. Outside of Google, I designed and co-taught courses in Microfinance and Social Business at the University of San Francisco and for 3.5 years served as the CFO for Global Health Corps. Over the past two years, I've been serving on the Junior Board at Opportunity Network.
